flowchart TD

## Multiple outputs

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Autonomic
- Endocrine
- Secretions, excretions
- Behavior
  - Body movements
  - Vocalization
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
```{mermaid}
flowchart TD
  P(processing) --> A[ANS]

```

## Types of movements

::: {.incremental}
- Reflexes
  + Simple, highly stereotyped, unlearned, rapid
- vs. planned or voluntary actions
  + Complex, flexible, acquired, slower
  - Discrete (reaching) vs. rhythmic (walking)
  - Ballistic (no feedback) vs. controlled (feedback)
  - Sequential

:::

## From neuron to muscle

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Neuromuscular junction
    + Releases acetylcholine (ACh) onto skeletal muscle fiber
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://www.siumed.edu/~dking2/ssb/images/NM040b.jpg)
:::
::::

## From neuron to muscle

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Motor endplate
    + Contains nicotinic ACh receptors (nAChR)
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/from-spinal-cord-to-muscle.jpg){fig-align="right"}
:::
::::

## From neuron to muscle

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- nAChR receptor opens
  - Na+ enters; K+ exits
  - Combined effect excitatory
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/from-spinal-cord-to-muscle.jpg){fig-align="right"}
:::
::::

## From neuron to muscle

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
+ Generates excitatory endplate potential (EPP)
    + Muscle fiber depolarizes
    + Depolarization spreads along fiber
    + Ca++ released from stores inside muscle
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/from-spinal-cord-to-muscle.jpg){fig-align="right"}
:::
::::

---

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Muscle fibers segmented into sarcomeres
- Myofibrils (w/in sarcomere)
    + Paired actin & mysosin proteins
    + “Molecular gears”
- Bind, move, unbind in presence of Ca++ plus energy source (ATP)
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/muscle-fibers-biopsych.jpg)
:::
::::

---

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Skeletal muscles have no "reverse" gear
  - Only contract
- Muscles often arranged in agonist/antagonist pairs
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-TpOC4my_NBc/T0J-MhEv29I/AAAAAAAAF88/dYLv7QzFwmg/s1600/Hamstring-Quad4.jpg)
:::
::::

## Muscles are sensory organs, too!

## Muscle fiber types

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- **Intrafusal** fibers
    + Sense length/tension
    + Ennervated (contract) via gamma ($\gamma$) motor neuron activation
    + Contain muscle spindles (sensory organs linked to Ia afferents)
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/muscle-fiber-types.jpg)
:::
::::

## Muscle fiber types

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- **Extrafusal** fibers
    + Generate force
    + Ennervated (contract) via alpha ($\alpha$) motor neurons
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/muscle-fiber-types.jpg)
:::
::::

## Monosynaptic stretch (myotatic) reflex

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Muscle stretched (length increases)
- Muscle spindle in intrafusal fiber activates
- Ia afferent sends signal to spinal cord
    + Activates alpha ($\alpha$) motor neuron
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/intrafusal-extrafusal-fibers.jpg)
:::
::::

## Monosynaptic stretch (myotatic) reflex

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Muscle contracts, shortens length
- Gamma ($\gamma$) motor neuron fires to take up intrafusal fiber slack
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/intrafusal-extrafusal-fibers.jpg)
:::
::::

---

![](../include/img/stretch-reflex.jpg)

## Avoiding tremor

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=50%}
- Polysynaptic *inhibition* of antagonist muscle
- Prevents/dampens tremor

- Brain gets fast(est) sensory info from spindles
:::
::: {.column width=50%}
![](../include/img/axon-size-speed-tradeoff.jpg)
:::
::::
